ProjectTitle: The development and function of type 1 innate lymphoid cells in inflammatory diseases
InitialFeedbackHistory: 21/06/2022 2. [REDACTED] you also collecting physical data (samples), you can also add these in the data description and consider storing and preservation under 5 and 6. 4. [REDACTED] A handy collection of metadata standards for your discipline is the MIBBI (https://fairsharing.org/MIBBI), for example MIFlowCyt also used by flowrepository and MINSEQE used by GEO and ArrayExpress. 6. Please note that the KU [REDACTED] RDM policy expects 10 years of data preservation (except of course the data that you are not allowed to keep). [REDACTED] you storing any personal data on hard-drives? Please contact your local IT team to discuss more secure alternatives 7. [REDACTED] you considered which repositories you will use for data sharing, in addition to domain specific repositories, for example www.ebi.ac.uk/submission/ you can also consider using KU [REDACTED] RDR (https://www.kuleuven.be/rdm/en/rdr).
